citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
An adult French Bulldog, "Tank," was being held for a flight departure from HNL to SFO on flight HA012 on June 1st,
2024 (AWB 173-35604435). On the outside of the enclosure was a "Live Animal Checklist" form with a space for a
certification by the consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24-hour
period, but that section of the form was not completed. Also, the consignor’s signature and date were provided on the
form but there was no indication of time it was signed. A complete certification with the required information and feeding
and watering instructions are important to ensure the animal's health and well-being during transport. Carriers and
intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in writing that the
dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding and watering in a
24-hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the enclosure and easily
read.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.14(c) 
   
Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers. 
An adult French Bulldog, "Tank," was being held for a flight departure from HNL to SFO on flight HA012 on June 1st, 
2024 (AWB 173-35604435). On the outside of the enclosure was a "Live Animal Checklist" form with a space for a 
certification by the consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24-hour 
period, but that section of the form was not completed. Also, the consignor’s signature and date were provided on the 
form but there was no indication of time it was signed. A complete certification with the required information and feeding 
and watering instructions are important to ensure the animal's health and well-being during transport. Carriers and 
intermediate handlers must not accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in writing that the 
dog was offered food and water within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding and watering in a 
24-hour period. The certification and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the enclosure and easily 
read. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility representative. 
 
 n
